content:
And semi-related, but I just realized that the RFC and tracking issue says it'll use the derive_enum_default feature, while the implementation is behind the derive_default_enum feature. This is 100% my fault given that I created both. Should I

  • change the RFC text and tracking issue to the feature gate used
  • change the feature gate to what the RFC says (causing breakage)
  • do nothing

changing the rfc/issue breaks less existing code than changing the feature name. since they're not even used eventually anyway, better a funny feature name for a while than breaking existing code (even if it's Nightly code). [but I'm not on t-libs]
That was my thinking. I just wasn't sure if someone had other thoughts.

It will of course be gated, but I wasn't sure whether to place it behind the impl_const_trait feature or create a new one (derive_const_default_enum)?

You can just use derive_default_enum as long as that one is unstable. Then if it is stabilized before impl_const_trait is stabilized, it can be switched to impl_const_trait.
